Posts.Content: Well done and congratulations x
Posts.Title: Last radiotherapy session done and ticked off - yay!

Posts.Content: Hi all just wanted to have a moan really,  had surgery last September that all went well, followed by chemo and rads ,that all finished end of May and I'm now on the tamoxifen ,so I was feeling pleased with myself although had lots of pins and needles in my hand and numbness I just put it down to the chemo, but things just got worse and worse so oncologist sent me for an MRI scan ,luckily it showed no further cancer .she then refered me to a orthopaedic doctor who after further tests has revealed its carpel tunnel and also a trigger thumb, he has recomended surgery as now my thumb has stopped working at all, he says as I need two procedures it needs to be done under general anaesthetic , I asked if it had been caused by the chemo but they think it's just coincidense .I cannot believe it after all I've been through ,now facing surgery and then more time off from work and not being able to drive for 2 or 3weeks, also hubby has been stopped driving due to ongoing medical problems ,so looks like taxi and buses for us for a while, have decided to go private for this as I just want it out of the way asap, then hopefully get life back to normal, sorry to whinge but needed to get it off my chest, op now booked for August 15th, love to all Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Something else now

Posts.Content: Hi Carole,thanks for your reply, I also finished treatment in May and I'm full of aches and pains ,my knees are terrible so I know how you feel, seems strange you also have carpel tunnel ,do you think it might be caused by the treatment, ??  I think my aches and pains are down to the treatment or now maybe the tamoxifen, wish you well ,Amanda
Posts.Title: Something else now

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah,thanks for your reply, no I'm lucky my friend and neighbour is a retired nurse ,so as I'm a bit sqemish she has offered to do them for me, I think you are very good doing them yourself,and I was pleased to hear you had more energy ,hope I will ,as I've been very tired . Hope you don't mind me asking but have you had any side effects as I have heard some people say they are nothing and others have suffered lots of pain, 1more to go for you well done ,have you got anything else to have after, love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: 4th FEC done

Posts.Content: hi all had my 4th FEC yesterday and so far so good, been given the injections ,to start on Saturday ,not looking forward to that , but at least I feel I'm getting there ,only 2 more to go,then the rads, hope everyone is ok today, love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: 4th FEC done

Posts.Content: Well done, enjoy your evening ,love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Race for Life done and dusted ....

Posts.Content: Hi Littlesusie, I know exactly how your feeling onwards and upwards, my sister is coming over from New Zealand on the 10th so looking forward to seeing her after all this, then just rads to do when she has gone home, enjoy your afternoon. Amanda x
Posts.Title: Happiness is .......

Posts.Content: Hi Helen just thought I would say hi, I know it's easy to say but don't feel to anxious.the chemo is manageable.I know we are all different but from my experience I decided against the cold cap as I had heard people say it was a bit unpleasant and some had lost hair even with using it, so I had the first chemo and yes my hair came out before the 2nd one, I have always felt very tired after it and rested for about 3days ,and taken the anti sickness as instructed, that was for the 1st 3 sessions, then on the 4th I forgot to take anti sickness in the morning and didn't feel sick so I didn't take any more and felt fine ,then on my 5th session I didn't take the anti sickness tablets at all and was fine, I'm due my 6th chemo in two weeks ,then move on to radiotherapy, I'm not suggesting that you don't take your meds ,just wanted to say maybe you won't feel sick and bad ,don't worry to much about it ,keep positive . Love and lots of luck Amanda x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy after double mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Clare, first of all ,all the best for the new year.Manuka a Honey ,well I can't recommend it enough, I think it's fab, I get the 25+ strength and have 1or2 tea spoons per day, I have had 2sessionns of chemo so far, and I just know it's helping me , It's quite expensive but if you go to hollandandbarret you can usually get them in the penny sale ,so that keeps the cost down, can't help with vitamin d , never taken that, wish you all the best ,Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Manila honey & vitamin d3

Posts.Content: Hi can anyone help, I finished chemo 3weeks ago, during the chemo I had mild tingling in my fingers of my left hand ,and numbness, for the past two nights I have been woken up during the night my whole hand is dead and numb ,so bad it had me in tears last night, it took ages to get any feeling back in it, I have looked at a few Internet sites that suggest it is caused by the treatment and can be worse at the end of treatment and take maybe 6months plus to get any better , has anyone else suffered with this or should I visit my doctor , any help would be really welcome ,Thanks Amanda
Posts.Title: Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi Alig58' thank you for your reply ,sorry to hear you gave the same problem ,but it's nice to know I'm not alone, it was so bad last night it kept me awake and had me in tears, dreading going to bed tonight , xx
Posts.Title: Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi yes I'm part of the curly club, finished treatment in May and now I gave a lovely mass of curls, oh happy days, I'm just pleased to have it back. XxAmanda
Posts.Title: Does anyone have curly chemo hair ?

Posts.Content: Hi Pat, well done you, hope you continue to be ok , remember don't over do things just take it easy for a few days. I've had 4so far and cannot wait to get this bit over and done. Take care love Amanda x
Posts.Title: One down.!!

Posts.Content: Hi Littlesusie, oh how lovely just what's needed to cheer you and nothing better than flowers, I love flowers in the house, take care love Amanda x
Posts.Title: Just had a nice surprise

Posts.Content: Hi little susie, just wanted to say hope you enjoy the film,looks a fun film for all to enjoy, pleased you are feeling well after your 3rd, I've just had 2nd yesterday and so far with resting I'm feeling ok, hope it lasts, let us know what the film was like loveAmanda xx
Posts.Title: What a different experience this time

Posts.Content: Hi Ali owl, I'm not a mum but hubby has been spoiling me, so having a lovely day, last chemo on Tuesday yippee , hope you are enjoying your day to , love Amanda x
Posts.Title: HAPPY MOTHERS DAY !!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi all ,thank you so much for your replies,it's so helpful to hear from others .i have till Tuesday when I go for next FEC ,so can give it some thought over the weekend, love Amanda
Posts.Title: G scf ,help

Posts.Content: hi all just after a bit of advice , I have now had 3 FEC ,all ok for the 1st ,then the 2nd was delayed due to low white blood cells, then the 3rd was delayed for the same reason, and I was due to have the 4th this week but yet another delay, I have today been for my bloods and all being well number 4should go ahead next Tuesday, but the hospital are now saying I will have to have these g scf ,injections after each FEC to boost white cells, I have been thinking do I really need them, does it really matter if the FEC number 5and6 were also delayed or is it really best to have them, I'm a bit worried about any side effects as I have been doing so well so far, can anyone give me advice ,and if you have had these injections how have you been affected, thanks in advance for any help, Amanda x
Posts.Title: G scf ,help

Posts.Content: Hi weemaw,so pleased for you,you deserve to be happy a visible hair line, that's great , I'm just getting used to the no hair ,mine came out last week ,and im still waiting for 2nd chemo delayed due to blood being wrong, have a great Sunday ,love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Strange things make me happy

Posts.Content: Hi Dragonlady, I also purchased the magnet about 6 weeks ago and it definitely helps, still have the odd hot flush but far better than it was , enjoy your weekend . amanda x
Posts.Title: LadyCare Menopause Magnets

Posts.Content: Lovely photo ,well done ,a daughter to be proud of xx
Posts.Title: VERY PROUD OF MY DAUGHTER

Posts.Content: Driving home for Christmas, Chris Rea ,is fab xx
Posts.Title: whats your fave xmas song lovely ladies ?

Posts.Content: Hi Mightymo, just wanted to say hi, you poor thing you are going through so much, so sorry to hear about your poor hand, and then a period as well ,one thing after another, I had a period just before the start of my chemo ,but haven't had any since and I've just had number 4, don't miss them and they cannot be sure if they will start up once chemo ends or if I will start early menopause, well good luck with everything take care Amanda x
Posts.Title: Chaotic week

Posts.Content: Hi sr23,yes of course you can ask my age I'm 52 so quite a bit older than you, my oncologist said the chemo might bring on a clinical menopause, or periods may resume after chemo, life is such a muddle ,nothing seems certain , but let's just keep our chins up , I wish you all the best , love Amanda
Posts.Title: Chaotic week

Posts.Content: Congratulations and well done, what a fantastic achievement ,you must feel very proud , love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: walked the O2

Posts.Content: Hi yes I purchased one a couple of weeks ago ,and although I have still had a few hot flushes ,they are a lot less than they were so I am sure it's working ,defiantly worth a go . Amanda
Posts.Title: menopause the solution

Posts.Content: Hi Littlesusie , we had chicken ,salad and lovely Jersey royal potatoes , with a nice bottle of Jacobs Creek Red, lovely to feel good again and enjoy a meal and a drink. Earlier today we went all round the shops looking for something to put on my new grey hair, found a coloured conditioner , so I'm a bit of a strawberry blonde tonight, love to all Amanda xx
Posts.Title: What a difference

Posts.Content: Congratulations ,and well done ,enjoy your weekend .love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: finished

Posts.Content: hi all just wanted to say I went with my best friend last night to see the film miss you already, think I should have researched this a bit more before hand. It is a good film with some funny bits in it but I shouldn't have gone it's just to close to call, seeing things like you have just gone through brings it all back ,my friend and I sat there in tears most of the time, must admit we were tempted to leave the cinema but we were right down the front and it was dark ,thought we may fall over trying to get up the stairs to leave so we stayed. Came home and both cried our eyes out together. Just really wanted to say maybe think twice before you go to see this film, maybe you will , might be just me who was silly enough to go, love to all Amanda x
Posts.Title: Miss you already

Posts.Content: What very wise words xx
Posts.Title: To all you lovely ladies out there.

Posts.Content: Thinking of you take care , love Amanda xx

Posts.Content: Well done you ,glad things are looking good for you .take care love Amanda xx

Posts.Content: Hi Crystal Kitty, just wanted to wish you well, love Amanda xx

Posts.Content: Hi Variflow, thank you so much for your reply , are the markings permanent or do they come of in the shower??, will let you know how I get on , have a nice day , Amanda x
Posts.Title: immune system

Posts.Content: Thanks for all the information,I had been wondering about low immune system etc as I finished chemo a week and a half ago , think it's going to take a while to get back to normal ,I'm going to hospital on Thursday for marking ready to start radiotherapy on 20th of April , not really sure what to expect ,and how you feel after and during the radiotherapy,if anyone can give any information I would be very grateful, enjoy Sunday everyone , Amanda x
Posts.Title: immune system

Posts.Content: Yes this is the best place ,thanks everyone loved the pink glove dance ,thanks again Dreamthief x
Posts.Title: This is the best BC forum!

Posts.Content: Hi Ali owl, just thought I would let you know, I had 4 FEC and its only now they have prescribed the injections for me. And I only have 2fec to go, they said it's because of low white blood cell count, got my bloods this Friday so will find out if the injections have worked, good luck ,Amanda xxx
Posts.Title: injections

Posts.Content: Hi blue roan, just wanted to say hi, you say you are on your own, just wanted to say you are not alone, we are all one big family here and we support each other , I am half way through my chemo so will gave a look at your link, take care love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: New - My experience so far. Will it help you? Stage 2 + lymph; HER2...

Posts.Content: Hi susie , reading your post ,well it could have been me writing it ,snap, it's just the same as me I've had it all the same as you and I'm pleased to hear I'm not alone ,never had any facial hair before but I'm just saying to myself well at least I'm here to see it, things could have been so different, had a bit of a joke with my husband about it and he just laughs and says he will lend me his comb, go and comb your face ,he says , men what can you do with them. The hot sweats have now been part of my life since I started my chemo, I bought a lady care magnet from boots, cost £30 but it seems to work, I do still get the sweats but they are not as frequent or as bad as they were ,maybe that's something to think about , only got to take the tamoxifen for another 4years and 10 months, chin up girl , we are all in this together , love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: I'm growing a hairy,furry face!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Tilly, I'm also on tamoxifen ,only been on it a month so far, but we flew 4and a half hours,  I put mine on before we checked in at the airport , then took them off about a hour after we landed, not sure if this is any help, have a great holiday ,Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Flight stockings

Posts.Content: Hi Tilly, I'm also on tamoxifen ,only been on it a month so far, but we flew 4and a half hours,  I put mine on before we checked in at the airport , then took them off about a hour after we landed, not sure if this is any help, have a great holiday ,Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Flight stockings

Posts.Content: Hi Grannylara, thanks for your reply yes at least christmas will be good I hope ,we are going to our daughters for dinner so no cooking for me to. Hope all goes well for you and you feel better soon, I'm sure your daughters will do you proud, hope you enjoy you dinner,take care love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Disappointed

Posts.Content: Hi all ,I'm feeling a bit disappointed. I was due to have my 3rd fec on Christmas eve, and had programmed myself ready ,thinking oh well at least that's the 3rd one done. I went up for bloods this morning and have now just had a phone call saying sorry bloods not right,so it's postponed untill 6th of January, I know at least I will be feeling good for Christmas,but also feeling a bit disappointed as its my 2nd delay, oh well hope everyone is feeling ok today , love and hugs for a merry Christmas to all. Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Disappointed

Posts.Content: Hi nettle, I was amazed to read your post, I have had it ,my god it's been so bad I could cut my hand off in the night. With me it's the same side as my wle ,snb, it started after chemo number 4 , then just when I finished chemo it started to really kick in , it wakes me up and it's so bad my whole hand from my fingers up to my wrist is so numb ,I shake it and it can take over half an hour to get it back then I go back to bed and here we go again, I've been crying with it some nights. I did get to see the oncologist two weeks ago , she said she is not sure what is causing it, so she arranged for me to have a MRI scan of my spine ,neck etc, she said it could be nerve damage caused by the snb,or it could be a trapped nerve in my neck , or it could be the chemo ,so I had the MRI last Sunday and should get the results in two weeks, I know exactly how you feel ,I get hardly any sleep some nights , think we had our diagnosis, op ,and treatment at the same time if I remember rightly, will let you know if I get any positive results , I'm away this weekend to Lanzarote so should get results on my return, hope I get on ok while I'm  away as it's driving me mad, will let you know, hope you get some sleep tonight , love Amanda
Posts.Title: Arm pain, numbness, pins & needles, only at night.......?

Posts.Content: Hi Jeanette, just thought I would say hi, I'm exactly half way through my chemo I was like you and really unhappy about losing my hair, but it's really not that bad ,my hair fell out about 3weeks after my first chemo, now strangely enough it's starting to grow a tiny bit, not sure if it will stay or if that will fall out, but honestly it's really ok, there are some lovely wigs and scarfs about and at this time of year lots of people are out in hats . When I'm at home a lot of the time I wear nothing on my head, so keep positive and remember it's only temporary, love and hugs ,Amanda
Posts.Title: Hair Care before and after Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi ,I used e45 cream twice a day ,helped quite a bit ,then progressed to bio oil ,all the best Amanda xx
Posts.Title: skin treatment after radio

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, sorry you had a bad week ,but pleased things are. A bit brighter for you know, hopefully some sunny warm days will be here soon that always helps a bit, I had last chemo last week so things are brighter for me now ,just rads and tamoxifen left, take care love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Hello my lovely friends

Posts.Content: Morning just wanted to wish you good luck for today, take care love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Starting FEC T today

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, welli started tamoxifen at the end of May, I'm on the wokhardt brand , I take it just before I go to bed each night, I get the odd hot flush during the night ,but nothing to complain about, my joints can be a bit of a pain but they have been since the chemo, so it's really ok ,nothing to worry about, hope that helps a bit ,take care from another Amanda xx
Posts.Title: Taking Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Littlesusie, your lunch sounds lovely,  nice to hear you enjoyed a meal out and a trip to the theatre last night, I'm just chilling out today chicken for dinner tonight , then 4th chemo on Tuesday, enjoy the rest of your weekend ,x
Posts.Title: It's Sunday

Posts.Content: hi all just off for my 1st mammogram since all this began, feeling a bit apprehensive x
Posts.Title: First mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi Littlesusie, oh that's lovely good to hear you have been and enjoyed it, I'm still waiting for mine ,they said it might be 31st of March, xx
Posts.Title: Look good, feel better

Posts.Content: Hi all ,thought I would share this with you,made me laugh. Hubby and I have just got home from a christmas shopping trip and while we were in Boots an assistant stopped us in the store and asked if we would be interested in a special offer they have on at the moment,he was holding a medium size box, hubby and I waited with bated breath as he opened the box in front of us, It was a hair dryer, curling tongs and straightner set, we just looked at each other and laughed ,as I lost all my hair about 4weeks ago, we declined and left ,chuckling to ourselves, brightened our day, love to all xx
Posts.Title: Bad hair day

Posts.Content: Hi all , I've had a really bad ear since Monday night,finally decided to see my. Doctor yes he said it's an ear infection I've never had one before in my life, so he prescribed an ear spray ,then said antibiotics as well, I explained my concern as I'm due to gave last chemo on Tuesday if my bloods ok this Friday. So when I came home I contacted the chemo unit and explained it all , they said yes that will be ok ,they said as long as the antibiotics are in your blood at least 72 before you have chemo then it's ok. Or did they mean 72hours before the blood test ,I'm not sure now. But keeping fingers and toes crossed really want to get the last one out of the way, has anyone else had antibiotics before chemo ? ,love to all Amanda x
Posts.Title: Ear infection

Posts.Content: Hi mrs D, poor you ,enjoy being at home love Amanda xx
Posts.Title: No place like home !

Posts.Content: Thanks Jacqueline, that's positive then ,makes me feel better already ,last thing I wanted is a delay at this stage , thanks again and all the best Amanda
Posts.Title: Ear infection
